course_title: Creative Writing Special Topics: Journalism in the Movies
class_notes:
(Same as FILM 385 1)
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)
(Application required. Complete course atlas information (including texts and grading) and application form will be available on the Creative Writing Program website in MID-OCTOBER: https://creativewriting.emory.edu/index.html)


Both accepted and waitlisted students are required to attend the first class.


Pre-requisite: none; this class is not open to first-year students
Writing sample required: 2 non-scientific papers that exhibit deep research (10-20 pages total)
course_description: Credit, variable; maybe be repeated for a maximum of eight hours credit when topic varies. Specific topics to be announced. Typical subjects include the novel, first person narrative, formalist poetry, and nonrealistic forms. ENGCW 270, 271, or 272 required as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 4099, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: H. Klibanoff, Status: Open
